response: * Samuel Sotheby (1771–1842), English auctioneer and antiquarian
* Samuel Leigh Sotheby (1805–1861), English auctioneer and antiquarian, son of Samuel Sotheby (1771–1842)
Bindley formed a collection of rare books, engravings, and medals, which were sold by auction after his death. Two series of sales, by Samuel Sotheby and Robert Harding Evans, raised over £20,000.
Samuel Sotheby (31 August 1805 – 19 June 1861) was an English auctioneer and antiquary.
He was born on 31 August 1805 in Hampstead, London, the son of Samuel Sotheby (1771–1842).
